sen.j: 内藤 弘矩（ないとう ひろのり）は、日本の室町時代後期の武将。
sen.e: Hironori NAITO was a Japanese busho (military commander) in the late Muromachi Period and head of the Naito clan who used to take the position of Shugodai (deputy military governor) as a chief retainer for the Ouchi clan of shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) for generations in Suo Province and Nagato Province.
Hironori NAITO was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the late Muromachi Period
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。"lived"を補いました。
sen.e: Hironori NAITO was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the late Muromachi Period
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 周防国長門国の守護大名大内氏の家老として、代々長門守護代を務める内藤氏の当主。
sen.e: He was also the head of the Naito family, whose family members assumed the post of Shugodai (deputy military governor) of Nagato Province for generations as a chief retainer of the Ouchi clan of shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He was also the head of the Naito family, whose family members assumed the post of Shugodai (deputy military governor) of Nagato Province for generations as a chief retainer of the Ouchi clan of shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大内政弘、大内義興の2代に仕え重きをなす。
sen.e: He served two generations of the lords, Masahiro OUCHI and Yoshioki OUCHI and held a critically important position in the domain.
He was a leading figure in the Ouchi clan by serving two lords successively, Masahiro OUCHI and Yoshioki OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He was a leading figure in the Ouchi clan by serving two lords successively, Masahiro OUCHI and Yoshioki OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 娘（東向殿）はのちに義興の正室となり大内氏嫡子大内義隆を生む。
sen.e: Later, his daughter (Higashimuki-dono) became Yoshioki's lawful wife and gave birth to Yoshioki's legitimate child, Yoshitaka OUCHI..
Later, his daughter (Higashimuki-dono) became Yoshioki's lawful wife and gave birth to Yoshioki's child, Yoshitaka OUCHI.
sen.cmt: ダブルピリオドです。義興の嫡男はYoshioki's sonとすればlegitimateは必要ないと考えます。
sen.e: Later, his daughter (Higashimuki-dono) became Yoshioki's lawful wife and gave birth to Yoshioki's child, Yoshitaka OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応仁の乱のため上京した大内政弘に従い、弘矩は在京、諸所の合戦に活躍した。
sen.e: Accompanying Masahiro OUCHI who came to Kyoto for the Onin War, Hironori was active in battles of various places.
Accompanying Masahiro OUCHI who came to Kyoto for participating in the Onin War, Hironori also stayed in Kyoto and made distinguished contributions in battles broke out in various places.
sen.cmt: 「弘矩は在京」が訳漏れです。「活躍した」を書き換えました。
sen.e: Accompanying Masahiro OUCHI who came to Kyoto for participating in the Onin War, Hironori also stayed in Kyoto and made distinguished contributions in battles broke out in various places.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 長期にわたり上洛し不在だった政弘に対して、1470年（文明 (日本)2年）に伯父の大内教幸（道頓）が謀反を起こした。
sen.e: Against Masahiro who stayed in Kyoto and was absent from home for a long time, Masahiro's uncle Noriyuki OUCHI (or Doton OUCHI) waged a rebellion in 1470 and Hironori's elder brother Takemori participated to support the rebellion.
In 1470, Masahiro's uncle Noriyuki OUCHI (another name Doton OUCHI) raised a rebellion against Masahiro who had been stayed away from home due to an extended stay in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1470, Masahiro's uncle Noriyuki OUCHI (another name Doton OUCHI) raised a rebellion against Masahiro who had been stayed away from home due to an extended stay in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それに兄の武盛が加担する。
sen.e: Hironori's elder brother Takemori also participated in the rebellion to support Noriyuki OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。言葉を補い，書き換えました。
sen.e: Hironori's elder brother Takemori also participated in the rebellion to support Noriyuki OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし乱は陶弘護らの活躍により鎮圧されたため、弟の弘矩が武盛に代わって父の跡を継ぎ内藤家の当主となった。
sen.e: Since the rebellion was subdued by efforts of Hiromori SUE and others, Takemori was replaced by his younger brother Hironori who succeeded to his father's position to become head of the Naito clan.

Since the rebellion was subdued by the efforts of Hiromori SUE and others, Hironori succeeded to his father's position to become the head of the Naito family instead of Takemori, although Hironori was the younger brother of Takemori.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を補いました。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Since the rebellion was subdued by the efforts of Hiromori SUE and others, Hironori succeeded to his father's position to become the head of the Naito family instead of Takemori, although Hironori was the younger brother of Takemori.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 政弘の代は、周防守護代陶弘護とともに大内家重臣として重きをなし、上洛した政弘の留守を守った。
sen.e: In the Masahiro's time, Hironori played an important role as a senior vassal together with Hiromori SUE, shugo daimyo of Suo Province, and held the fort when Masahiro stayed in Kyoto.

In the Masahiro's day, Hironori played an important role as a senior vassal of the Ouchi clan together with Hiromori SUE, the shugo daimyo of Suo Province, and held the fort while Masahiro stayed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 「大内家」重臣が訳漏れです。冠詞を補い，さらにwhenを・・の間のニュアンスがでるwhileに換えました。
sen.e: In the Masahiro's day, Hironori played an important role as a senior vassal of the Ouchi clan together with Hiromori SUE, the shugo daimyo of Suo Province, and held the fort while Masahiro stayed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1482年（文明14年）に、宴席でその弘護が遺恨のあった吉見信頼に討たれる事件が起こる。
sen.e: In 1482, when Hiromori was killed at a banquet by Nobuyori YOSHIMI who had a grudge against Hiromori, Hironori killed Nobuyori as punishment on the spot and sorted out the mess.
In 1482, Hiromori was involved in an accident and killed at a banquet by Nobuyori YOSHIMI who had borne a grudge against Hiromori.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「事件が起こる」のニュアンスをいれました。
sen.e: In 1482, Hiromori was involved in an accident and killed at a banquet by Nobuyori YOSHIMI who had borne a grudge against Hiromori.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 弘矩はその場で信頼を成敗し、事態を収拾する。
sen.e: Hironori sorted out the difficult situation by executing Nobuyori on the spot.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。"mess"は口語なので書き換えました。成敗に処刑の意味を含めました。
sen.e: Hironori sorted out the difficult situation by executing Nobuyori on the spot.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後は大内家随一の重臣として権勢を振るう。
sen.e: Thereafter, as the most important vassal for the Ouchi clan, Hironori wielded great power.
Thereafter, Hironori wielded great power as the most influential vassal of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 「随一の重臣」は「最も影響力のある」という意味で訳しました。
sen.e: Thereafter, Hironori wielded great power as the most influential vassal of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.e: He was killed as a criminal by Yoshioki Ouchi.
He was killed as a criminal by Yoshioki Ouchi.

sen.j: 1494年(明応3年)に病態の政弘が義興に家督を譲ったあとは、若年の君主を補佐した。
sen.e: After Masahiro who had got sick transferred responsibility for the family to Yoshioki in 1494, Hironori supported the young lord as an aid.
After sick Masahiro transferred the headship of the family to Yoshioki in 1494, Hironori assisted the young lord.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: After sick Masahiro transferred the headship of the family to Yoshioki in 1494, Hironori assisted the young lord.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし翌年、義興への家督相続に際して兄弟の大内高弘の擁立を画策したと陶弘護の子陶武護が義興に讒言した。
sen.e: In the next year, however, Hiromori SUE's son Takemori told a slander to Yoshioki that Hironori had orchestrated a plan to field Yoshioki's brother Takahiro OUCHI for the successor of Masahiro, and Hironori was killed as a criminal together with his son Hirokazu by the order of Yoshioki who believed the slander.

In the next year, however, Takemori Sue, the son of deceased Hiromori SUE, told Yoshioki an ungrounded story that Hironori had schemed to let Yoshioki's brother Takahiro OUCHI succeed as the head of the family instead of Yoshioki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。原文の「讒言した」はslanderより重い内容で使われていると考え書き換えました。
sen.e: In the next year, however, Takemori Sue, the son of deceased Hiromori SUE, told Yoshioki an ungrounded story that Hironori had schemed to let Yoshioki's brother Takahiro OUCHI succeed as the head of the family instead of Yoshioki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それを信じた義興の命により、弘矩は子の弘和とともに誅殺された。
sen.e: Yoshioki, who took Takemori's word for it, issued an order and killed Hironori together with his son Hirokazu as a criminal.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Yoshioki, who took Takemori's word for it, issued an order and killed Hironori together with his son Hirokazu as a criminal.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: のちに弘矩が無実であることが判明したため、義興は弘矩の娘を正室に迎えるとともに、弘矩の死後家督を継いだ弘春の嫡子興盛に弘矩の娘をめあわさせるなど、弘矩の名誉回復と内藤氏との関係修復に腐心した。
sen.e: Since Hironori's innocence was proved later, Yoshioki accepted one of Hironori's daughters as his lawful wife, and allowed Okimori Naito, a son of Hiroharu Naito who had succeeded to Hironori as head of the family, to get married to another one of Hironori's daughters, thus making efforts to mend relations with the Naito clan.

Since Hironori's innocence was proved later, Yoshioki spared no pains to repair relations with the Naito family: for example, he took a Hironori's daughter for his lawful wife, and let Okimori NAITO, a son of Hiroharu NAITO who had succeeded as the head of the Naito family after Hironori's death, marry to another Hironori's daughter.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。「内藤」を大文字に換えました。
sen.e: Since Hironori's innocence was proved later, Yoshioki spared no pains to repair relations with the Naito family: for example, he took a Hironori's daughter for his lawful wife, and let Okimori NAITO, a son of Hiroharu NAITO who had succeeded as the head of the Naito family after Hironori's death, marry to another Hironori's daughter.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 讒言した武護は死を賜った。
sen.e: Takemori was killed on the charge of slander,
Takemori was executed for entrapping Hironori by making an ungrounded story.
sen.cmt: 「讒言した」はslanderより重い内容と考え書き換えました。
sen.e: Takemori was executed for entrapping Hironori by making an ungrounded story.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 義興に嫁いだ娘は、義興の嫡男亀童丸（のちの大内義隆）を産んでいる。
sen.e: Hironori's daughter married to Yoshioki gave birth to Yoshioki's legitimate son, Kidomaru (later, Yoshitaka OUCHI).
Hironori's daughter who married to Yoshioki gave birth to Yoshioki's son, Kidomaru (later, Yoshitaka OUCHI).
sen.cmt: 義興の嫡男はYoshioki's sonとすればlegitimateは必要ないと考えます。
sen.e: Hironori's daughter who married to Yoshioki gave birth to Yoshioki's son, Kidomaru (later, Yoshitaka OUCHI).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 陶弘護暗殺後の陶氏の家督争いには、弘矩が暗躍したともいわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Hironori operated behind the scenes in the battle for succession of the family ownership of the Sue clan after the Assassination of Hiromori SUE.
It is said that Hironori was behind the succession dispute in the Sue family broke out after Hiromori SUE was assassinated.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: It is said that Hironori was behind the succession dispute in the Sue family broke out after Hiromori SUE was assassinated.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、文人としても活動しており、当代屈指の連歌師宗祇とも交流した記録がある。
sen.e: Hironori was also active as a man of literature and there is a record that he had contact with Sogi, one of the best renga poets of the time.
Hironori was also active as a man of literature, which is shown in a document that he had contact with Sogi, one of the most prominent Renga (Japanese collaborative poetry) poets in those days.
sen.cmt: 「当代屈指の連歌師宗祇」で連歌の説明を，また形容詞を換え原文のニュアンスに沿うようにしました。
sen.e: Hironori was also active as a man of literature, which is shown in a document that he had contact with Sogi, one of the most prominent Renga (Japanese collaborative poetry) poets in those days.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
